Key Match Events: South Africa won by 1 wicket with 16 balls remaining
South Africa chased the target of 271 runs in 47.2 overs
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa's last win in ODI World Cups against Pakistan came in 1999
South Africa entered the game as strong favourites
Pakistan's campaign was struggling with three consecutive losses
South Africa aimed to break their 24-year jinx against Pakistan
Babar Azam emphasized the importance of his batting form for Pakistan's chances
Marco Jansen was highlighted as South Africa's X-factor
Post-Match Reflections: Shadab Khan admitted Pakistan's recent failings and drew hope from history for a comeback
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was expected to be quicker than usual for Chennai
There was a slight chance of a passing shower but a full game was likely
Hasan Ali and Shaheen Shah Afridi were close to reaching 100 ODI wickets
Quinton de Kock was one century away from tying AB de Villiers for most World Cup hundreds for South Africa
